item.title: Disable MacOS SSH Password Login
item.description: Create 000-hostname.conf in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.d 000-hostname.conf UsePAM no PasswordAuthentication no Restart SSH sudo launchctl stop com.openssh.sshd sudo launchctl start com.openssh.sshd

item.title: SSH Keys
item.description: create ssh key in terminal ssh-keygen -a 100 -t ed25519 -f ~/.ssh/id_ed25519 -C "john@example.com" -a: It’s the numbers of KDF (Key Derivation Function) rounds. Higher numbers result in slower passphrase verification, increasing the resistance to brute-force password cracking should the private-key be stolen. -t: Specifies the type of key to create, in our case the Ed25519. -f: Specify the filename of the generated key file. If you want it to be discovered automatically by the SSH agent, it must be stored in the default .
